{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3131552,"name":"Divyansh Agarwal","username":"DivAgarwal1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/e95f7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T22:58:42.994Z","cooked":"

Our team recently started using a CTRE Pigeon 2. We want to use the built-in accelerometer to estimate our position, but we don’t know how to use it meaningfully due to the accelerometer bias. Does anyone know how the Pigeon 2 accelerometer is supposed to be used?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-21T22:58:42.994Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":476,"reads":230,"readers_count":229,"score":2451.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":424262,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-accelerometer","display_username":"Divyansh Agarwal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://store.ctr-electronics.com/pigeon-2/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Pigeon 2.0","clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56050,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-accelerometer/424262/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3131574,"name":"Sean B","username":"Phlogiston","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/phlogiston/{size}/180763_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T23:23:15.238Z","cooked":"

I’m assuming you want to estimate the robot’s position on the field using accelerometer data. I haven’t used the pigeon 2 yet, but I tried to figure this out with the original pigeon. I found out that it is basically impossible. You have to double integrate the incredibly noisy raw translation information, which drifts almost instantly to a useless value. I doubt it is much better with the pigeon 2. The best you can hope for is to detect collisions - you’d be much better off doing wheel-based odometry.

DivAgarwal1:

accelerometer bias

What do you expect to use the accelerometer for? The manual states

3.4. Accelerometer Calibration
Accelerometer is factory calibrated. Additional user calibration is not necessary.

Maybe you are calculating the robot tilt say on the Charge Station? That’s the atan2() of the 2 axes in the tilt plane. The roboRIO builtin accelerometer also works the same way.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-21T23:44:10.243Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":212,"readers_count":211,"score":92.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":424262,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-accelerometer","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-accelerometer/424262/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3131593,"name":null,"username":"Nougat","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nougat/{size}/194836_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T23:51:47.996Z","cooked":"
DivAgarwal1:

Our team recently started using a CTRE Pigeon 2 . We want to use the built-in accelerometer to estimate our position, but we don’t know how to use it meaningfully due to the accelerometer bias. Does anyone know how the Pigeon 2 accelerometer is supposed to be used?

The Pigeon 2.0 is more meant to be (and has mainly been used as) a gyroscope rather than an accelerometer. If you are attempting to try to double-integrate it to determine your position, then the pigeon is not the most accurate of accelerometers and certainly has a lot of noise which is difficult to get rid of and isn’t the most practical for dead reckoning purposes.

Champ in the making!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3131620,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-22T00:19:55.063Z","cooked":"
Nougat:

If you are attempting to try to double-integrate it to determine your position, then the pigeon is not the most accurate of accelerometers and certainly has a lot of noise which is difficult to get rid of and isn’t the most practical for dead reckoning purposes.

I’m not sure there’s an IMU in the FRC legal price range that is accurate enough to be useful for positioning.

For reference, he’s using the accelerometer in conjunction with odometry.

Champ in the making!"},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-accelerometer/424262/7","custom_user_title":"Yo! Champ in the making!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3132072,"name":null,"username":"Nougat","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nougat/{size}/194836_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-23T01:37:01.651Z","cooked":"

In that case, regression filters might be of some consideration to create a better estimate, but the benefit is likely to be subliminal due to the noise and potentially large amount of experimentation required. Either way, the pigeon is still suited to be a better gyroscope which would be one of the ways it can pair with odometry.
